page.title: 12Mark's History
page.content: The Vicarage was the birth-place of Admiral{Sir Mark Pizey}(now living in Burnham) who had a distinguished Naval career.His father was vicar of Mark in 1900 when he was born and when on holiday in Richmond,Yorkshire,The Reverend Pizey wrote to his parishioners:".....Your little namesake (Mark) is learning to make great use of his legs and everyone sayes does credit to our Somersetshire air......" A fascinating link with the past. At the turn of the century there were 2{schools}in Mark. The West Mark School(where the present Mark 1st School stands) was erected in 1875 for 96 chldren,slightly smaller today. The East Mark School enlarged in 1890 for 123 children was endowed with Â£23 10/- It closed in the 1920s. East & West Mark are now called just "Mark".
